summary: The pope is the leader of the Catholic Church and is based in Rome. He is also known as the "father" or "pontiff." The pope is considered the successor of Saint Peter, who was given special powers by Jesus. For a long time, the pope had political power in addition to religious authority. Today, his role is mainly religious, but he still has great influence worldwide. The current pope, Francis, was chosen in 2013.
title: Pope
